author: timesunion.com
title: Noteworthy
text:
Heuser sets UAlbany field hockey record
University at Albany junior field hockey midfielder Paula Heuser became the career leader with 64 goals for the Great Danes on Friday.
Heuser scored two goals to help UAlbany get past Maine, 3-1 and passed Tovah Atwell , who set the mark in 1999, as the program's leading scorer.
Basketball: Gregg Popovich of the San Antonio Spurs will replace Mike Krzyzewski as the U.S. basketball coach following the 2016 Olympics. ... LeBron James has not been medically cleared to practice because of his back and he says it's not certain he will play in the season opener.
College basketball: Andre McGee resigned as assistant coach at University of Missouri -Kansas City, saying he could no longer do the job as he fights "false" allegations by an escort that he hired dancers to strip and have sex with recruits and players while coaching at Louisville.
Golf: Brett Stegmaier was 6 under for the round and 11 under overall with three holes left for a one shot lead when second-round play was suspended because of darkness at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open . ... Justin Rose shot a 4-under 66 in the Hong Kong Open to take a one-stroke lead over Lucas Bjerregaard ... Ji Eun-hee took a one-stroke lead over Lydia Ko in the LPGA Taiwan Championship.
Tennis: Steve Johnson beat Kevin Anderson 5-7, 7-6 (5), 6-4 to reach the Erste Bank Open semis. Johnson plays Ernests Gulbis , who beat Ivo Karlovic 7-6 (4), 7-6 (5). David Ferrer beat Fabio Fognini 6-4, 6-2. Ferrer will play Gael Monfils , who beat Lukas Rosol 6-7 (3), 6-3, 6-3.... Tomas Berdych advanced to the semis of the Stockholm Open after a 7-5, 6-4 victory over Grigor Dimitrov Richard Gasquet beat Jeremy Chardy 2-6, 6-3, 7-6 (4). Jack Sock beat Gilles Simon 6-2, 6-4. Marcos Baghdatis beat Gilles Muller 7-6 (5), 4-6, 6-3. ... Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova beat Daria Kasatkina 2-6, 6-2, 6-4 in the semifinals of the Kremlin Cup. Pavlyuchenkova faces Svetlana Kuznetsova , who beat Lesia Tsurenko 6-2, 6-4. Roberto Bautista Agut reached the semis with a 6-4, 6-2 win over Lucas Pouille He next faces Philipp Kohlschreiber
Staff and wire reports
